title: Since Riot is removing all the band-aids they added from the old rune system during preseason.....
body:
Isn't it time to remove the +15% attack speed from Jungling items? It's very clear now that it never needed to be added in the first place, and Riot could've just adjusted some jungler's base attack speed instead.

Precision exists for a reason and if Junglers want that extra attack speed for smooth jungle clears they should sacrifice other runes and stats for it instead of being overcompensated.

replies.body: It's timely that this has popped up because I raised this just Friday as something to address. Whether or not we do a change along these lines, I got pretty consistent feedback that people would rather see the flat damage removed/reduced than the on-hit Attack Speed. It's somewhat expected. Anytime an Attack Speed number is touched anywhere, people always start with the 'clunky' arguments.

If you don't mind me asking, do those clunk arguments have weight? Because there is always a mixed result about what people clarify as 'clunky'. Viktor having a longer delay on his Aftershock? Clunky. Akali having to Auto to get her mark off? Clunky. 

From a designer perspective, what is "Clunky"?

I think those arguments can have some weight. Assuming we have several viable iteration paths (comparable balance implications), we ought to take the one that has the fewest negative feels implications. Usually I associate players' usage of the work clunky as "has negative feels implications." Sometimes we have to do those things because there aren't other viable iteration paths, though the definition of viable as used here is probably also up to interpretation.

Well, there are several junglers who are dependent on multiple hit effects. So we need our AS to be decent early. {{champion:20}} has Visionary, {{champion:5}} has Determination and Three-Talon Strike, {{champion:266}} has Blood Thirst/Blood Price, {{champion:131}} has Moonsilver Blade, {{champion:77}} has Tiger Stance, {{champion:245}} has whatever the hell his passive is called, {{champion:421}} has Queen's Wrath. I could go on, but I won't. Junglers don't have "Press Q, entire ability comes out". AS affects the time it takes for our damage to come out.
Is it possible champs need an AS buff across the board and power from AS items get weakened to compensate for it?

{{item:1041}}'s attack speed was added for champions like {{champion:11}} and {{champion:102}} who had playerbases who used attack speed _and nothing else_ in their runes. I was one of those players, and even with that change, I still don't have as much attack speed as before, and my clears don't feel as fast, but I do like the change on Junglers who I didn't do this on (such as {{champion:60}} and {{champion:104}}) because honestly, while it makes their clears better, they're not exactly overperforming as it is. It's not like it's a huge power creep, since I'm pretty sure the best Junglers would still be the best Junglers without this.

Wouldn't you prefer it if Riot just removed the 15% attack speed so they could directly balance those champions instead? The 15% attack speed bonus just adds a generic amount of power to the jungle that was not needed for the vast majority of jungle champions. Underperforming champions could obviously be compensated in a better way after.

It's kind of like Duskblade in that Duskblade adds a huge layer of generic strength to the assassin class but it means they're balanced exclusively around that 1 item instead of emphasizing their own unique strengths and weaknesses as champions.
